entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of unground

description: From Middle English ungroundid, ungronded, ungrundid, ungrounded; equivalent to un- +â€Ž grounded.

adjectives.description: ungrounded (comparative more ungrounded, superlative most ungrounded)

entries.meaning: Not grounded; without ground or basis, unreal, false.
examples: The defendant's claims are fictitious; they are entirely ungrounded in fact.

entries.meaning: (electricity, electronics) Not connected to ground potential
examples: Unlike coaxial cable where the outer conductor is grounded, twisted pair is usually ungrounded.
